conversation.NPC: Hello officer, what can I do for you?

PLAYER.TALK: You can start by telling me where you where the night Thomas Moore died

conversation.NPC: I was here, reading in the library.
I already told everything to you. Why are you really here?

PLAYER.TALK: You really don't know. I think you know why I'm here.

conversation.NPC: Can we end this charade and just get to the point?

PLAYER.TALK: I know you did it. I know you are the killer.

conversation.NPC: Me, why do you think so?

PLAYER.TALK: The evidence doesn't lie. Your prints are all over it.

conversation.NPC: What do you mean? What evidence?

PLAYER.TALK: I understand you tried to clean up behind yourself, but I still managed to find it.

conversation.NPC: Your bluffing, I did't leave anything behind.

PLAYER.TALK: So you say you did it?
Well, we can do this the easy way or the hard way. Just come with me to the station.

conversation.NPC: You got me, but he deserved it. He was a terrible man.

PLAYER.TALK: Even so, it is not our job to decide who lives and dies.
The game is over. I got you and you are going to jail.
